overview: This subject builds on the student's knowledge in radiology, particularly as it applies to the neuro-musculo-skeletal system. The student will be able to explore normal and pathological findings as displayed by a variety of imaging modalities including x-ray, CT scans, MRI and US imaging. They will also have a better appreciation of when to use imaging, which imaging modality to use and when onward referral to another clinician may be more appropriate.
ilo: an appreciation of when and how to request imaging as well as which modality to use for a particular condition
advanced skills in understanding the interpretation and clinical implications of radiological findings
appropriate skills in the interpretation of pathology, with awareness of the limitations
a better understanding of radiology reports to enable correlation of the findings with the images
generic_skills: Advanced skills in understanding interpretations and clinical implications of radiological finding
Skills in interpretation of appropriate pathologies
Critical thinking, problem-solving and analytical skills
Improved capacity to detect detail in visual images

Prerequisites.content: Minimum 12 months clinical experience in the area of Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy.
Applicants will be required to provide a copies of transcripts for their Physiotherapy qualification, and a brief resume.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home
